fields.description:
All guests must be age 21+ with valid identification, there are no exceptions.   
Follow us 
    
 exclusive invitation - one evening only 


Join us for a one evening only art and jazz event featuring a performance by the Stephane Wrembel Trio for a dynamic skyline event. Admission is complimentary.  Kindly RSVP. 
Visual Artists Lineup To Be Announced.  
Doors open at 6pm Be Our Guest!
Monday, April 27th 6pm-9pm 
Venue Address: Gansevoort Park Avenue Penthouse 2 
420 Park Avenue South 
About Stephane Wrembel:
 
“A REVELATION” –Rolling Stone Magazine”Intense and full of charisma.” -The New York Times”One the greatest guitar players I’ve ever seen …and I don’t say that lightly.” –Relix Magazine”[Wrembel embodies] a John Coltrane-ish search for a moment of musical nirvana…” -Variety”A truly astonishing talent…” –All About Jazz
Composer Stephane Wrembel hits the road this winter – bringing his jaw dropping talent, palpable musical rapport with His Band, and vivid and textured compositions to life on theater stages along the east coast and Midwest. 
Parisian born Wrembel – whose music embraces all styles and influence to create a truly signature sound – is being hailed as one of the world’s most dynamic and inspired players out there today. Wrembel is indeed a standout – not only for his undeniable skills but also for his unparalleled ability to create a unique and vivid listener experience. 



like our events? FOLLOW US for more NYC Invites to Private Cocktail, Charity and Art Events!

fields.name: Small Business Expo 2015 - New York City
fields.description:
FREE TO ATTEND! REGISTER TODAY. 
****WANT TO EXHIBIT?  Call us today at 212.404.2345*** 
  
Small Business Expo is THE largest & most anticipated business-to-business networking event, trade show & conference for business owners, entrepreneurs & decision-makers.  If you are serious about your business, this event is a "MUST ATTEND." 
Small Business Expo is the most anticipated networking event of the year for business professionals to learn about products & services to help their business exceed its goals, network with other industry professionals & attend informative and cutting-edge workshops & seminars. If you are a business owner, entrepreneur or someone that works for a small business you should attend this trade show & conference. 
ATTENDING SMALL BUSINESS EXPO IS SIMPLE! Choose your badge option from the options listed below. Your badge will be emailed to you (bring it with you to the show.) For a complete description of each item, VISIT OUR WEBSITE. 
   

WANT TO EXHIBIT & REACH THOUSANDS OF BUSINESS OWNERS? 
If your product/service targets small business owners, exhibiting at this show is a must. Nowhere else can you speak with thousands of business owners, reach your target market face-to-face and make on-the-spot sales!  Call us at 212.404.2345 or VISIT OUR EXHIBITOR PAGE. 

WHY ATTEND? 

Network with other business professionals & check out the exciting exhibitor hall
Establish hundreds of new contacts and reconnect with old ones.
Attend business critical workshops & seminars.
Learn about new products and services that will help your business grow.
Interact with the movers and shakers of your industry.
Discover new and innovative technologies.
Be in the RIGHT place at the RIGHT time.
It's FREE!!!

Participation is an opportunity that cannot be missed if you dare to stay ahead of the competition!
 
Dress Code: Business Casual 
Terms & Conditions: 
By completing your online registration you are accepting and agreeing to our Terms & Conditions.  If you do not accept our Terms & Conditions, do not register.  Thank you for your cooperation. 
All sales are final.  There are NO REFUNDS for any items that you purchase.

fields.name: Entrepreneurship 101 - 2014/2015
fields.description:
It's never too late to start your entrepreneurial journey! Catch up on previous lectures here  
Course Description: 
Interested in learning more about entrepreneurship? Looking to start a new venture? Look no further! MaRS offers a free, non-credit introductory course on entrepreneurship that introduces individuals to the nuts and bolts of building a business. 
Entrepreneurship 101 is MaRS’ flagship free weekly lecture series featuring enlightening lectures on key topics related to starting a successful business, aimed at social innovators, technology and life sciences researchers and trainees. 
Entrepreneurship 101 lectures cover a diverse range of introductory business topics including funding your business, marketing, recruiting, intellectual property and more. 
Special lectures include: 

‘Lived It Lectures’ feature celebrated entrepreneurs and their success stories and challenges.
‘Meet the Entrepreneurs’ are panel sessions during which entrepreneurs from different sectors discuss the challenges and opportunities they face as they grow their businesses. These events have networking opportunities after the panel session for entrepreneurs in each sector.

 This non-credit course is designed to introduce members of the research and academic community to issues relating to starting and growing a business. It is especially aimed at graduate students, post-docs, faculty, technicians and others active in research in a scientific or engineering discipline, those who have an interest in creating a company to exploit the results of their research, and those interested in social innovation. 
  
NOTE: You only need to register once at ANY time for the whole lecture series. Email confirmations are dated September 24, 2014 and are good until May 6, 2015. See below for registration details. 
Please arrive early at each session to be sure of a seat. If you wish to have your attendance recorded in order to attain a course certificate, please note that attendance registration will end at 6:15 p.m. 
Questions? Email entrepreneurship101@marsdd.com 
Part of the Entrepreneurship 101 Series 
  
Connect Online: 
Webcast 
www.marsdd.com/webcasts 
Website www.marsdd.com/ent101 
Twitter Join the conversation #ent101 Follow @MaRSDD for updates 
LinkedIn http://marsdd.it/LinkedIn-Ent101 
Blog www.marsdd.com/blog 
Weekly Email If you've registered for the event then you'll get the weekly email with links to the webcast, resources from the week before (video, blog, facebook, slideshare presentation) and a reminder about the coming week's lecture.

fields.name: New York City's Bacon and Beer Classic 2015
fields.description:
The BACON AND BEER CLASSIC is coming back to NYC for their 2nd Annual gluttonous takeover of Citi Field on Saturday, April 25th! 
  
  
When you enter the legendary home of the New York Mets, Citi Field Ballpark, you will explore the stadiums concourse all while sipping hundreds of craft brew samples and enjoying mouth-watering bacon-inspired tastes local NYC restaurants have cooked up exclusively for the event. 
While you're enjoying the sips and tastes of the event, you'll enjoy great music, play interactive games that will bring out your inner kid, as well as participate in cooking demos and beer schools – whether you're an expert or a novice – you'll leave knowing a thing or two more about bacon and beer!  
 
  
We have four ticket types available for each event: 
General Admission includes:

Three-hours of bacon + craft beer indulgence!
Variety of over 100 craft beers
Taste over 50 different bacon-inspired dishes from local restaurants
Access to the concourse and seating areas throughout the stadium
Souvenir Bacon and Beer Classic branded glass
Craft beer and bacon educational sessions  (Past sessions have included: brew making, pig butchering, how to cook bacon)
Music, interactive games, photo booths, live DJ, miscellaneous fun


General Admission Exclusive Early Access includes:

One hour early access to the event
Expedited entry into event
Four-hours of bacon + craft beer indulgence!
Variety of over 100 craft beers
Taste over 50 different bacon-inspired dishes from local restaurants
Access to the concourse and seating areas throughout the stadium
Souvenir Bacon and Beer Classic branded glass
Craft beer and bacon educational sessions (Past sessions have included: brew making, pig butchering, how to cook bacon)
Music, interactive games, photo booths, live DJ, miscellaneous fun


VIP Admission includes:


Everything listed above under General Admission
One hour early access to the event
Exclusive VIP area on warning track + dugouts
Exclusive samples of craft beers on the field
Complimentary coat and bag check

Designated Driver includes:


Three hours of bacon indulgence!
Taste over 50 different bacon-inspired dishes from local restaurants
Access to the concourse and seating areas throughout the stadium
Complimentary non-alcoholic beverages
Craft beer and bacon educational sessions  (Past sessions have included: brew making, pig butchering, how to cook bacon)
Music, interactive games, photo booths, live DJ, miscellaneous fun



  
 
  
New York City's Bacon and Beer Classic 2015 Two sessions available on Saturday, April 25, 2015! Brunch: 12-3pm  Evening: 7-10pm  If you decide to indulge in both sessions, you'll need a ticket for each session to attend!  *VIPs are granted admission to each session one hour earlier!* 
  
All attendees must be age 21 or over. All Bacon and Beer Classic tickets are sold via Eventbrite. 
For more information, directions, and frequently asked questions about Bacon and Beer Classic, please visit our website: www.baconandbeerclassic.com • facebook • twitter • instagram  
 
  
 
We're looking for rockstar volunteers to help us make the 2nd Bacon and Beer Classic at Citi Field a success! Follow this link for more information and to sign up!

fields.name: Open Garden Squares Weekend - 10 Downing Street Garden Ballot 2015
fields.description:
Open Garden Squares Weekend is delighted to announce that the garden at Number 10 Downing Street will once again be participating in the Weekend.  There will be two tours on Sunday 14 June 2015 at 11am and 2pm. 20 places are available on each tour and these are allocated by public ballot.  The ballot will be drawn after 18th May and the lucky winners contacted at the beginning of June 2015. 
To register for the ballot please select whether you would like to apply for one or two places above and complete the required questions.  If you would like to apply for two places, please ensure you give both your details as well as the details of the second person who you would like to attend, when you register.  
 Entry into the ballot assumes acceptance of the following terms & conditions 

Entrants must be over 16
Only one entry per person via this website. (If you have purchased an OGSW ticket you can still enter this ballot)
Incomplete, multiple or false entries will not be included in the ballot
If your are selected for a place on the tour you must take photographic id with you (either a passport or driving licence)
Up to two places on the tour are allocated per person and that will be the person/people named in the ballot entry. You may not pass your place onto any other individual
There are two tours and winners will be allocated onto either one - times / dates are not negoitable 
Tours are subject to last minute cancellation and /or changes in timing and none of the organisers / parties involved can be held liable for any inconvenience or financial loss should this happen
The ballot will close on 18 May and winners will be notified at the beginning of June 2015.
Places on the tour are randomly chosen from those who have bought complete tickets for the Open Garden Squares Weekend and those entering the ballot here.  
The places chosen will be final and no correspondence will be entered into. If you don't hear from us, your ticket number will not have been chosen
The ballot is not open to employees of the London Parks and Gardens Trust and Downing Street, nor their relatives  
We will not pass your information onto any third parties without permission, however those selected for a place on the tour will have their details submitted for a basic security check.

fields.name: HOLI HAI 2015 by NYC Bhangra Dance Company
fields.description:
COLORS FROM OUTSIDE WILL NOT BE PERMITTED 




 
  





NYC BHANGRA  presents 
HOLI HAI 2015 



 



We are celebrating the 6th anniversary of NYC Bhangra's Holi Hai, the Indian festival of colors. Come enjoy the music, culture, colors, dance, food, and much more!  
NYC Bhangra’s mission of engaging diverse audiences into Indian performing arts is in line with the Holi festival. Besides bringing culture and Indian traditions to many American Indians and other communities of New York, Holi Hai continues to engage diverse audiences into India's: food, music, dance and festivals. 



 



Watch the highlights of Holi Hai 2014: https://vimeo.com/121439279 





 
  





Volunteer with us 






We appreciate the love and support you have given us in the past years by volunteering your time. Bringing this grand festival to New York City is always our pleasure and a lot of hardwork. Your help and support has provided us the platform to make this bigger each year. And we will not be able to make this more successful without you!  
BECOME A VOLUNTEER: Fill the volunteer form





  






BOLLYWOOD NITE @ SUITE 36 
Friday, 24th April 2015 





In support of Holi Hai 2015 



 




Buy Early Bird Tickets Online for $15 
Click Here for Tickets 





 




 
  




COLORS FROM OUTSIDE WILL NOT BE PERMITTED 




 
  




 








  

  
FAQs 
  
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
All ages are welcome to the event. This is a family friendly event and you are more than welcome to get kids along. You don't have to register separately for kids.  
However, you will be required to show a valid ID in case you are one of the winners in the Raffle contests. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
Your registration also enters you into the Raffle contest. You will be required to show a valid ID which matches the information on your ticket in case you are one of the winners in the Raffle contests. 
Both printed and tickets on mobile phones will be accepted as valid. 
 
How do I get to the festival venue?  
Dag Hammarskjold Plaza can best be accessed by walking from the 51st street subway stop of the 6 Train, the Lexington Av/53rd Street stop on the E and M Trains, or from Grand Central Station for those arriving by MetroNorth. 
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
There is no dedicated parking facility. Street parking may be available in the vicinity of the park plaza which is located at the intersection of 1st Ave and 2nd Ave on 47th St  
  
What can/can't I bring to the event? 
You cannot bring colors from outside. Environmnent friendly and safe colors will be available for sale at the venue. 
  
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
Email us at holi@nycbhangra.com 
  
Is my registration/ticket transferrable? 
No. Your registration also enters you into the Raffle contest. You will be required to show a valid ID which matches the information on your ticket in case you are one of the winners in the Raffle contests. 
   
I have registered and have a ticket for myself. Can I bring kids along with me without a FREE ticket? 
Yes. You can bring kids with you without getting a separate ticket for them. Your free ticket is your entry to the raffle contest. 
  
What do I need to do if I win one of the Raffle prizes? 
You should be 18+ and have a valid government ID that matches the information on your event ticket to claim your prize.

fields.name: "Up Right Atlanta" by Nick Cave
fields.description:
This April, get ready for the event of the season! Presented by Flux Projects (the producers of Flux Night), this Spring’s groundbreaking performance is Up Right Atlanta, an astonishing night of artistic dance, cultural symbolism, and unique storytelling from acclaimed artist Nick Cave, with choreography by Atlanta’s own T. Lang. 
  
Up Right Atlanta calls for “initiates” to become warriors of their own destiny. It will be an unforgettable event that you can't miss! 
 
Held over three days, with 2 performances per day, at Ponce City Market, these visually-stunning performances are free and open to the public. 
  
And join us for an exclusive sneak peek of the show at our Patron Party with Nick Cave on Thursday, April 23rd. 
Please note: the Patron Party is a paid event and only 100 tickets will be sold. First come, first serve. 
Click here for info: Purchase tickets  
  
Praise for Nick Cave: 
“Nick Cave's hybrid creations are part Alexander McQueen, part Andy Warhol, and wholly bizarre, brash, and beautiful. He combines elements of sound, performance, color, and costume to create whimsical works that even the darkest soul would find hard to resist.”  
– Artspace 
  
“Cave's genre-expanding work straddles both dance and visual art to explore the ways that African identity is subsumed into disparate cultural codes.” 
- Artspace 
  
Links:  
Flux Projects: http://www.fluxprojects.org  
Nick Cave Art: http://nickcaveart.com/Main/Intro.html 
T. Lang Dance: http://tlangdance.com/

fields.name: Broad Ripple Art Fair @ The Indianapolis Art Center May 16th & 17th
fields.description:
BROAD RIPPLE ART FAIR May 16th and 17th 
Start your summer fun at the Broad Ripple Art Fair at the Indianapolis Art Center! Indy’s #1 art fair features high-quality, one-of-a-kind, original art by more than 225 artists and artisans. 
Serious art collector? The Broad Ripple Art Fair is a nationally ranked, highly selective, juried art fair. Just looking for something beautiful for the home or garden? We’ve got you covered there too. 
While you’re here, enjoy fantastic food, Sun King Brewery beer, non-stop live music and performance, artist demonstrations, interactive art activities and children’s activities too! Join us at Indy’s kickoff to the summer festival season! 
Tickets are available in person at the Indianapolis Art Center and Sun King Brewing. New this year - every ticket sold at these locations, you’ll receive a complimentary bus pass courtesy of IndyGo. Tickets are also available at: Adobo Grill, Punch Burger and La Chinita Poblana. 
Features: 

Shop from more than 225 national-level artists and craftsmen selling handmade, one of a kind art.
Hands-on art activities and demonstrations in every studio inside the Art Center. New this year, take a Pop-Up class at the Art Fair and get treated like a VIP!
Live bands and performers on three outdoor entertainment stages: a WTTS Riverfront Stage, WFYI Blues House Party Stage and a Christel DeHaan Family Foundation Cultural Arts Stage.
For the kids – a WFYI Kids’ Stage inside in the Basile Auditorium and 3 Prizm creativity tents
A gourmet food court featuring some of the city’s finest restaurants and chefs.
Sun King Brewing beer and Cooper Hawk Winery and Restaurant wine all around the fair.
Dozens of Indy cultural organizations in our Cultural Arts area.
An “Emerging Artist” area, where Art Center students can experience life as a professional artist.
Top 100 Art Fair, top Indiana Fair

When: 

Saturday, May 16, 2015 10 am-6 pm
Sunday, May 17, 2015 10 am-5 pm
Special Broad Ripple Art Fair Preview Party Friday, May 15, 2014 from 6-8 pm

  Where: 
The Broad Ripple Art Fair takes place on the grounds of the Indianapolis Art Center, its ArtsPark, and the North Side Optimist Opti-Park, located at 67th Street and College Avenue in the Broad Ripple Village Cultural District.    For directions to the fair or to find out more, visit: www.indplsartcenter.org/BRAF

fields.name: Asylum Steampunk Festival VII
fields.description:
Weekend at the Asylum is the longest running and largest steampunk festival in the World.  For four days thousands of steampunks from around the globe will be taking over the historic quarter of the beautiful city of Lincoln. Splendidly attired and polite people thronging the medieval streets and enjoying entertainments, features and fun in venues which include the Castle, County Assembly Rooms, Bishop Grossteste University and Westgate Academy. 
All of the main day  features of the event are covered by our wristbands.  You can buy a festival wristband which runs from Friday until Monday or you can buy single day bands for Saturday, Sunday or Monday.  The wristband affords you entry to the Assembly Rooms (Main programme stage, exhibition etc) Castle Ward (Makers' Zone, Outdoor Stage, Feature Arena, Trader Zone) Westgate Academy (Literature Zone and Gaming Zone) and Bailgate Methodists Hall (Indoor Market)    In addition there will be a market which is open access in Castle Square and we are planning a few open features here too.  (The general public can also pay to enter the Castle independently - the entry is projected at £12 Please note this does include the Magna Carta exhibition which is not open to our wristband holders.) 
Evening features (and a few daytime features) are all ticketed seperately since they are limited capacity.  
Further information on each ticket is listed under the "more info" button.  This may not show on some mobile devices.  Your tickets are emailed to you. Present them on your mobile device or a printed copy at the Asylum to collect your wristbands or for entry into each evening feature.  If you misplace them they will be mailed to you again just before the event. 
  
  
TERMS AND CONDITIONS. The event is subject to change without notification.  Under fives go free to all daytime features when accompanied by an adult with a wristband.  We are sorry but we cannot ordinarily refund tickets unless the event is cancelled.  We do allow people to sell on tickets as long as this is at face value or less.  Profiteering etc is strictly forbidden and can result in tickets being cancelled without refund.  (This means if you pay over the odds for a ticket you may find it is invalid!)  If you do sell on your ticket pass on your e-ticket to the new buyer and let them have a covering note from you confirming the transfer.  Include a mobile number so we can check with you if there is a  problem at the event.

fields.name: Anime Expo - July 2nd - July 5th, 2015
fields.description:
Anime Expo, also known as "AX", is the largest Japanese popular culture event in North America, and will be held at the Los Angeles convention center July 2nd - 5th, 2015.  
For the latest information, please visit our website at: Anime-Expo.org 
Reminders 
NAME CHANGE POLICY UPDATE : Due to the new registration system and updated security requirements, name changes on purchased registrations will no longer be permitted. Please make sure to have your full, legal name attached to any new registrations. 
Please bring your printed registration confirmation for each attendee along with valid photo IDs. You may also use your smartphone access your registration confirmation using Eventbrite's mobile app. 
The only child attendee package we provide is the 4-Day Child Pass for a fee (children 5 and under are free of charge but still need to be registered). Please purchase this for your child even if he or she is attending for just one day. 
All attendees under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult in order to pick-up a badge. All children under the age of 15 must be accompanied by an adult at all times. 
With the exception of the South Hall registration area, you must wear your badge at all times inside the convention center. 
Registration Inquiries: https://www.eventbrite.com/contact-us/  General Inquiries: http://www.anime-expo.org/contact-us/ 
  
DID YOU REGISTER BEFORE 1/28/2015? 
The barcode that was sent when you first registered is no longer valid and will not be scannable. A new registration confirmation will be delivered to your email from Eventbrite. This confirmation can be presented at the Pre-Registration counter electronically (via Eventbrite App or QR code in the email) or printed. Please make sure to use this registration confirmation as it is the only barcode that will be valid at Badge Pick-Up.   This applies to registrants who purchased any of the following badges from 7/4/2014 -1/28/2015: 
• 4-Day Badge • Child Badge • Premier Fan Badge 
If you purchased a badge between 12/31/2014 - 1/28/2015 and would like to request a refund, you must contact to process this cancellation.    If you purchased a badge between 7/4/2014 – 12/30/2014, you do not meet the 30-day refund requirement but you may request a transfer to 2016. Please contact Eventbrite Customer Support. 
If you registered for Artist Alley between 7/4/2014-1/28/2015, you should receive an update from the Artist Alley team within February. Thank you very much for your patience! 
  
FAQs 
  
Are there ID requirements or age requirements to enter the event? 
A valid photo ID, as well as your registration confirmation email, containing the QR code, is required to be presented to staff in order to receive your badge. Acceptable forms of identification include: Driver’s License, School ID, Work ID, Passport, Military ID, etc. 
Please purchase a 4-Day Child Pass for your child even if he or she is attending for just one day. Children ages 5 & under are free of charge while there is a fee for children ages 6-12. You must purchase an General Pass along with any Child Passes. 
All attendees under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult in order to pick-up a badge. All children under the age of 15 must be accompanied by an adult for the duration of their time at the event. 
Any programming designated 18+ will require attendees to show a valid photo ID in order to gain admittance. 
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
Parking is available at the Los Angeles Convention Center. There are many public parking lots available in the surrounding area. Shuttle service will also be available for participating hotels. Please visit our website for updated information. 
  
What can/can't I bring to the event? 
Click here for our Code of Conduct. 
  
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
Registration Inquiries: https://www.eventbrite.com/contact-us/ 
General Inquiries: http://www.anime-expo.org/contact-us/ 
  
What is the refund and transfer policy? 
Your refund request must be received within 30 days of your registration purchase date. After 30 days, you may request for a transfer once, good only for the following year.  
Due to the new registration system and updated security requirements, name changes on purchased registrations will no longer be permitted. Please make sure to have your full, legal name attached to any new registrations. 
Any requests for a cancellation or a transfer must be submitted in writing by June 23, 2015 to http://www.anime-expo.org/contact-us/. This applies only to requests from Anime Expo 2015; requests from prior expos will not be accepted.  
  
  
Can I update my registration information?  
http://www.anime-expo.org/contact-us/ 
   
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
Please bring your printed to ticket for each attendee to the event in order pick up your badge. 
  
The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay?  
Your registration must match the attendee. Each attendee must bring their photo I.D. 
  
Los Angeles Convention Center 1201 South Figueroa Street  Los Angeles, CA 90015 
  
Pre-Registration Badge Pick-Up Hours 
Day 0: Wednesday, July 1st 12 PM ~ 11:59 PM Day 1: Thursday, July 2nd 12 AM ~ 8 PM Day 2: Friday, July 3rd 6 AM ~ 8 PM Day 3: Saturday, July 4th 6 AM ~ 8 PM Day 4: Sunday, July 5th 6 AM ~ 2 PM

fields.name: 47th Annual GoPro Hangtown Motocross Classic
fields.description:
30GoPro HANGTOWN MOTOCROSS CLASSIC promoted by the Dirt Diggers North Motorcycle Club 
It‘s not just any motocross race, but the oldest and one of the most prestigious in the United States. Hangtown is the opening round of the 12-race Lucas Oil Pro Motocross Championship sanctioned by the AMA. 
 Past Hangtown races have been legendary, with unbelievable battles between Bob Hannah and Marty Smith, Jeremy McGrath and Jeff Emig, and Ricky Carmichael and James Stewart. Other legendary battles were against the track, when in 1991, it rained so hard the first turn was under 4 feet of water with hay bales floating down the track. That race made history, as privateers won both races: Doug Henry in the 125 class and John "Junkyard" Dowd in the 250 class. Privateers have not won both races before, or since that fateful Hangtown race in 1991. 
The late Danny "Magoo" Chandler kept Hangtown fans at the edge of their seats for years, with a riding style that has not ever  been duplicated.  Bob "Hurricane" Hannah graced the crowd with his feet-off-the-pegs style and was a Hangtown favorite. Doug Henry amazed the Hangtown faithful with a convincing win in 1997 aboard the world-changing Yamaha YZ 400 four-stroke. Ricky Carmichael and James Stewart scorched the Hangtown track in 2006 when they battled for 30 minutes straight, and never were more than a few bike-lengths apart. 
Every year, there is a new battle to witness, and a new legend to be re-told. Perhaps it is the Hangtown mystique that makes Hangtown racing legendary. Many people say that attending Hangtown is a way to be a part of motorcycling history. 
In 2014, the Dirt Diggers North Motorcycle Club, which promotes Hangtown, decided to take Hangtown to a new level of professionalism, updating its logo and restructuring how it does business. The Club began this new era by introducing a new standard for the pro awards. The Club constructed a framed shadow box of Civil-War era revolvers. These awards were designed to be the best of the best, and Racer X Magazine awarded DDNMC its Best Pro Trophy award, given to the race with the best pro awards. DDNMC strives to create the best experience for the racers and fans alike, and 2015 will be no different.  Racing gets underway on Thursday, May 14 at 9am, with some of the best amateurs in the country doing battle. Amateur racing continues into Friday, May 15 at 9am, when the top experts and Pro Am's compete for pro points, which leads to a professional license in the premier professional series. This years marks the return of the WMX, the professional women's MX series. Their first moto will be on Saturday the 15th. 
On Saturday, May 16, the top pros in the world hit the track for timed practice and qualifying around 8:30am. Opening ceremonies start at 12:25pm and racing gets underway at 1pm. The women's WMX second moto will get underway at that time. At 2 pm, the pros take to the track. A full action-packed day from sunup to sundown!  To get tickets and full race information about the Hangtown Motocross Classic, go to www.hangtownmx.com and click on tickets. In addition to General Admission tickets, the GoPro Hangtown Motocross Classic has some of the finest high-end hospitality areas in the entire series. Prepare to be pampered in the Superticket area with food and drinks, start-line seating, all-day pit passes, and great swag. The Superticket area, along with other hospitality areas, are limited in number, and sell out every year so don't wait!  Many of the hospitality areas include an all-day pit pass, which makes these hospitality areas an experience like no other. With many different ticket choices to choose from, and some with limited seating, make your selection online and beat the rush. 
Come out and be a part of history. The history of Hangtown.  Adults $40, Kids $20, Under 5 FREE 
ALL SALES ARE FINAL, NO REFUNDS

fields.name: The Rainbow Run 2015
fields.description:
The Rainbow Run is Ireland’s most fun 5k run! Now in its third year now, this unique run involves participants of all abilities and ages being doused from head to toe with coloured powder paint while they run, jog or walk our beautiful 5km route along Dun Laoghaire’s West Pier on 20th June 2015 
  
The Rainbow Run is entirely focussed on FUN so there is no competitive atmosphere, no recorded times and no age restrictions, all that matters is that you enjoy yourself and finish covered in loads of colour! You can be an Olympic athlete or someone entering a run for the first time in your life, it really doesn't matter at all. The real winner on the day is the person who has the most fun! 
  
Everybody should try to start the race dressed in as much white as possible (although not essential) and at intervals along the route you will be bombarded with different colours until you cross the finish line and enter the colour festival covered in a kaleidoscope of pinks, blues, greens, yellows, purples, reds and every mixture of colours you can think of! Don’t worry though, the powder that we use is a non-toxic and natural corn-starch based product that will not stain your hair or cause damage to anybody. 
  
We really are bringing the party to the Post-Run Spring Break Party by having the fantastic 80s supergroup Spring Break performing everyone’s favourite hits as they cross the finish line and during the large colour bomb that will occur in the finish area!

fields.name: #iAMaNURSE in a social media world
fields.description:
As the use of social media is increasing, many health care organizations are embracing social networks as a tool, not only for promotion, but to provide patient education in an accessible format. With this growing trend for social media in the health care arena, Capella University and ANA Leadership Institute have brought together a panel of social media experts and advocates to discuss the benefits of social media use in health care and tips for today's nurses in this highly social-sharing world. 

***Successful completion of this CNE activity is worth 1.0 contact hour*** 

 Panel Moderator: 
  Christy Davidson, DNP   @ChristyCapellaU    Interim Dean, School of Nursing and Health Sciences at Capella University
Panelists:   

  Brittney Wilson, RN, BSN   @TheNerdyNurse     Nurse and founder/creator of The Nerdy Nurse blog   
  


  Katie Duke, RN, MSN, AGACNP-BC   @TheKatieDuke   Public Figure, Nurse Advocate, and Social Media Maven 


  Kati Kleber, RN, BSN   @NurseEyeRoll     Critical Care Nurse, founder/creator of Nurse Eye Roll blog, and author  


  Lee Aase   @LeeAase   @MayoSMHN   Director, Mayo Clinic Center for Social Media 
  
  


Panel Objectives: 


Define 3 ways a nurse can benefit within their career with the use of social media. 


Describe acceptable behavior on social media for nurses. 


Identify 3 trends in which social media has benefitted patient care and/or the health of populations. 


Discuss how nurses can effectively and ethically use social media to advance the nursing profession. 


  
The American Nurses Association Center for Continuing Education and Professional Development is accredited as a provider of continuing nursing education by the American Nurses Credentialing Center's Commission on Accreditation.  ANCC Provider Number 0023  ANA is approved by the California Board of Registered Nursing, Provider Number CEP6178.

fields.name: Wanderlust Squaw Valley 2015
fields.description:
What is a Wanderlust Festival? 
Wanderlust Festivals are all-out celebrations of mindful living. We start by bringing together a remarkable group of yoga and meditation instructors, musical performers, speakers, artists and chefs for a four-day retreat in the world’s most awe-inspiring natural resorts. But Wanderlust is about more than our lineup: it is a truly participatory gathering, a place to learn, practice, and grow. 
THE WANDERLUST EXPERIENCE 
Practice 
Yoga & Meditation Programs 

Whether you’re an experienced yogi, meditator or are brand new to practice, you can create your ideal day at Wanderlust. There are classes for all levels, as well as a wide variety of practice styles and venue types. Mix in meditation or relaxing yin classes with sweaty, uplifting vinyasa, or challenge yourself with something new like standup paddleboard yoga. Each festival offers a taste of internationally recognized teachers as well as top local instructors. 
Listen 
Headliners, new artists and beyond 

Music is the beating heart of Wanderlust Festivals. Our music lineup is just as much about discovery as it is about seeing artists you know and love. Revel in a wide variety of musical performers in myriad settings, from epic main stage performances to intimate acoustic shows to the many performances accompanying our yoga classes. 
Explore 
Hikes, Runs, Biking & more 

Get outdoors and dive deep into the surrounding natural beauty with one of Wanderlust’s many guided adventures. Lace up for a trail run or sunset hike, drift off during a mountaintop meditation with live music, or challenge your natural awareness on a foxwalk – barefoot and with eyes closed! Every festival has its own unique adventures to connect you with the local landscape. 
Learn 
Lectures from the thought leaders of today 

The Speakeasy is Wanderlust Festival’s lecture series on subjects pertaining to the mindful life. With an inspiring lineup including prominent authors, yoga teachers, musicians, health experts, business leaders, and filmmakers, the Speakeasy provides a casual setting for speakers to offer a short lecture and respond to attendees’ questions. 
Taste 
From craft food trucks to organic fine dining 

Wanderlust offers a variety of local, sustainable and artisanal fare throughout the festival, whether you’re grabbing a quick bite from the hand-picked vendors in our Food Co-op or sitting down at the Farm to Table Dinner. For those with a wee bit of thirst, we also offer Wanderlust Uncorked, small gatherings featuring the best craft wine & beer and even better company. 
WATCH THE VIDEO 

  
Learn More 
For more information visit Wanderlust Squaw Valley
Included is a Subscription to EatingWell Magazine 
A one-year subscription to EatingWell Magazine is included with 3 Day and 4 Day tickets. (A $6 value, click here for subscription details and refund information) 
*This offer is not valid on mobile-purchases.

fields.name: Green Miles 5k Experience
fields.description:
GREEN MILES 5K EXPERIENCE 
 
GREEN MILES 5K EXPERIENCE -  San Bernardino, CA 
  
What is the Green Miles 5K Experience?  
The Green Miles 5k™ is a unique canna-awareness, celebration. We're not walkin' , we're rockin'!  Along the course, participants will dance,*medicate, enjoy street performers, games, and giveawys.  Our event is a celebration of compassion, equality, and wellness. We’re rockin' to ratify the laws that say, “It’s ok to medicate!"  In addition to music, treats, and memorable moments, this one- of- a- kind event will feature, teach-ins and  meducation opportunities. 
  
 THE LAYOUT 
18 AND OVER AGE RESTRICTION 
  
2:15 PM – The Green Gates Open 
Attendees check in and survey all of the wonderful exhibitors in MariJuanderland as they mingle and vibe! 
4:20 PM – The Green Miles 5K Experience Begins 
Mile One: FLOWER POWER 
Grooving along to the best of the 70’s and Old School Funk, participants will encounter a new age FLOWER POWER experience, symbolic of all things freedom, love, and peace! 
Mile Two: SINSEMILLA WAY 
Whine ya waist, and sway your hips to the hot sounds of the Caribbean, as you move through the ALL GREEN EVERYTHING mile of our event. As you move along to Reggae, Salsa, and Dancehall, let go and get caught up in the 420 energy of your surroundings. Laugh, dance, and be GREEN! 
Mile Three: MILE HIGH! 
You're feeling good, now! Vibe to the sounds of Hip Hop, Dub Step & Pop, as you move through a smoky green haze. At the finish line, you can join others as we paint and stamp our feet on THE GREEN MILES MURAL, to illustrate the steps being taken in the right direction to support Medical Cannabis! 
The CELEBRATION 
 We welcome you to enjoy the only CANNABIS EVENT of it's kind. The GREEN MILES 5K EXPERIENCE promises to be an unforgettable celebration of progress! With DJ’s, Live Entertainment, magician's, stilt walkers, street performers, surprise guests, premium munchies, ONLY the BEST meds/edibles, speakers, and so much more...  This is one party you don’t want to miss! 
 
   
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:  
  
What is the Green Miles 5K Experience? 
The Green Miles 5k Experience is a cannabis friendly, extraordinarily colorful, fun and entertaining walk. Along the course, participants will celebrate, dance, legally medicate, and share stories of how they came to walk with us.  
  
What is the purpose of the Green Miles 5K Experience? 
This event advocates for compassion, equality, and wellness.  We’re walking to ratify the laws that say, “It’s ok to medicate!”  
  
Who is the organizer of the Green Miles 5K Experience? 
CanI?Liv is the organizer of the Green Miles 5K Experience. This company was developed to service patients within all legal states, and to establish Wellness facilities in those approved areas. For more information visit www.caniliv.net 
  
Is the Green Miles event 18 and over? 
Yes, the Green Miles 5k Experience is an 18 and over event.  
  
How will the Green Miles 5K Experience educate? 
This interactive event will feature two hours dedicated to fun, family oriented education and involvement, as well as two hours dedicated to a comprehensive celebrity teach-in. 
  
What can the scheduled speakers teach me that I do not already know? 
In addition to providing facts and figures, the various teachers, entertainers, and celebrity speakers will share stories which highlight and demonstrate ways in which Medical Marijuana has improved the quality of life for long suffering patients, in desperate need of relief. Speakers will share organizing techniques which empower Medical Marijuana advocates. They will also help you to better understand and protect your rights.  
  
Is it legal for participants to medicate on the premises? 
Green Miles 5K Experience organizers have designed this event to be in compliance with CA prop215 and SB420. Smoking, vaping, dabbing are approved activities while on the venue premises. Thus, people can medicate in designated areas, including throughout Marijuanderland & along the 5K course. 
  
Is the Green Miles 5K Experience a sporting event? 
The Green Miles 5K Experience is entertaining walk for a good cause. It is not a sporting event.  This first ever 3.1 mile party in motion is a celebration, and not a timed competition. 
  
How does the Green Miles 5K Experience benefit patients in need? 
CanI?Liv, the organizers of the Green Miles 5K Experience, allocates a portion of the proceeds from each event to the CanI?Liv Wellness Program. This patient assistant program funds healthcare, advocacy and education. 
  
What will make the Green Miles 5K Experience so exciting? 
The Green Miles 5K Experience will feature highly entertaining alternative to all other cannabis related events. This celebration will place cannabis under a worthy spotlight. We're done with the stigma, it's time to represent! All attendees will have an opportunity to leave their footprints on "The GREEN MILES MURAL". 
  
Will the Green Miles 5K Experience be an event that encourages drug use? 
Medical Marijuana, which may be ingested in various forms, has been proven to safely bring relief to chronically ill patients. Medical Marijuana is a drug similar to other common prescription drugs including pain relievers, anti anxiety drugs, anti depressants, and antineoplastics.  Our goal is not to encourage drug use, but to make this alternative medication available to patients in need. 
  
Will the Green Miles 5K Experiencedamage the reputation of our city, county and state? 
The Green Miles 5K Experience organizers constantly communicate with public officials and have the support of numerous elected officials. Thoughtful planning and preparation by festival organizers ensures that this event will help to improve the image of, and generate revenue for our geo governmental bodies. 
  
Does allowing people to Medicate during the Green Miles 5K Experience violate the law? 
CanI?Liv, the organizers of the Green Miles 5K Experience, have been careful to make certain there are no laws, rules or regulations broken during this fun, law abiding event. 
  
Are people who Medicate during the Green Miles 5K Experience required to have or purchase a Medical Card? 
Yes. There will be Doctors on site to issue recommendations for qualified patients.  
  
How will you prevent underage smoking at the Green Miles 5K Experience? 
To ensure compliance with existing laws, highly trained event management officials, stationed at the admission gate, shall request that those persons who appear to be underage provide proof of age. 
  
Will there be adequate staff to helpGreen Miles 5K Experience participants in need of direction or assistance? 
There will be an ample number of course monitors and facilitators strategically placed throughout the Green Miles 5K Experience course and facilities. In addition to answering all questions, and providing any needed assistance or advice, those staff members shall make certain the event is a safe and orderly. 
  
Are donations to the CanI?Liv - Green Miles 5K Experience tax deductible? 
Due to the nature of our industry, our advocate position and our corporate status, donations are not tax deductible. 
  
Is the Green Miles 5K Experience Handicapped Accessible? 
The total venue including the entire 5k walking route is Handicapped Accessible and ADA compliant. 
  
Is the Green Miles 5K Experience a safe environment? 
The venue is completely fenced in and all entrances and exits are secured by professional security personnel. Weapons will not be allowed on the premises. All persons entering will be visually screened. The organizers are careful to acquire all necessary permits, as well ascomply with all laws, rules, and regulations.  
  
Is there adequate parking on or near the National Orange Show Events Center? 
There is ample onsite parking available, for a minimal fee.

fields.name: OpenStack Summit May 2015 - Vancouver
fields.description:
The OpenStack Summit will be held in Vancouver, May 18-22, 2015, at the Vancouver Convention Centre. 
Continue to check http://openstack.org/summit for the latest announcements. If you have any questions regarding the Summit please contact summitreg@openstack.org.  
The Summit is a five-day conference for OpenStack contributors, enterprise users, service providers, application developers and ecosystem members.  Attendees can expect visionary keynote speakers, 200+ breakout sessions, hands-on workshops, collaborative design sessions and lots of networking. Keynote sessions will take place Monday and Tuesday, the main conference will run Monday – Thursday. The Design Summit, a special track for active technical contributors to plan the next software release, will run Tuesday – Friday. See below image for reference. 
Two Tiers of Registration: 
Full Access Pass: Access to all Breakout Sessions and Workshops, Developer & Operator working sessions, Keynote presentations, Marketplace Expo Hall, Lounges, etc. This pass includes lunch 
Keynote + Marketplace Pass Access to the Keynote presentation from industry leaders and Marketplace Expo Hall to explore sponsor booths and to network. This pass does NOT include access to any breakout sessions (including sponsored sessions and tracks) or the developer and operator working sessions. This pass ONLY includes access to the Keynote presentations and the Marketplace Expo Hall. This pass includes lunch 
REFUNDS & TRANSFERS If you'd like us to cancel or transfer your ticket, please email summitreg@openstack.org before May 13, 2015 stating your name and Eventbrite order number. We can provide you with a full refund if you email us before this date. Refunds and Transfers will be granted until May 13, 2015 - after this time no refunds or transfers can be made.  
CODE OF CONDUCT                                                                                                              The OpenStack Foundation is dedicated to providing an inclusive and safe Summit experience for everyone, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, nationality or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of Summit participants in any form. By registering for this event, we expect you to have read and agreed to the OpenStack Summit Code of Conduct.

Smartphones, Smart TVs, Tablets, and Wearables are the fastest growing area of technology innovation. MobileWeek NYC 2015, April 17-23, 2015, is the conference, hackathon, and week-long series of events across New York City where the next generation of engineers, entrepreneurs, and executives master the skills behind the mobile revolution. 
Philosophy 
Mobile + Device development is the enabler of a connected life. We are facing the second generation of mobile technology, where smart phones and devices are more than just an extension of the desktop web - they are creating new touchpoints across health, communication, entertainment, business, and technology. Smart phones and devices are not “the new desktop”, they are a new way to live and work.

Mobile Development

fields.name: Dirty Scurry Adventure Run 2015
fields.description:
5th Annual Dirty Scurry Adventure Run!! 
On April 25, 2015 PT Fitness will host its 5th Annual Dirty Scurry Adventure Run. The Dirty Scurry Adventure Run is a mud run for kids (ages 5-14) that is reaching out to our surrounding community. With a 1.2 mile obstacle mud course, we are hoping to attract kids of our community that are interested in improving overall health while at the same time supporting Cook Children's (sports rehab, childhood obesity and child life program). 
The 1.2 mile fun mud run will begin at 9am and take you through 12 obstacles! Belly crawls, tire walks along with other fun and dirty obstacles will be along our adventure held at LaGrave Field 301 NE  6th Street. along the Trinity Trails of Fort Worth. 
Chip timing is available for those with a more competitive spirit! Bring your friends, classmates, siblings, cousins or any other friends associated through community organizations and get dirty! Price includes official race t-shirt and swag bag!  
We are excited that you are going to be part of the 2015 Dirty Scurry; it will be muddier that ever! 
With all of the proceeds going to Cook Children’s Hospital Childhood Obesity and Sports Rehabilitation, we have a few different opportunities for fundraising. 
We have added the option to “Sponsor a Child”.  This will allow us to open the event up to kids who might not otherwise have the chance to participate, while still raising money for Cook’s. 
We also have a link to our fundraising site.  Here kids can personalize their own fundraising page with why they are raising money for Dirty Scurry and get the word out to family and friends about their participation. 
Once you have registered for the race don’t forget to come back to this page and hit “Click here to begin fundraising”.  
We will see you at the finish line!

fields.name: Sulla Rotta di Taras 2015
fields.description:
La più emozionante attività di dolphinwatching dello Ionio, vivrai una giornata da ricercatore a bordo di TARAS, splendido catamarano da ricerca della Jonian Dolphin Conservation.  
Tu, con i ricercatori della JDC identificherai gli esemplari fotografando la loro pinna dorsale (foto identificazione), ascolterai e registrerai fischi e clicks degli esempalri (vocalizzazioni), raccoglierai dati di valutazione ambientale delle acque del Mar Ionio (parametri oceanografici) e compilerai le schede di avvistamento cetacei. Tutti questi dati saranno trasmessi e consultabili sull’Obis-Seamap (Ocean Biogeographib Information System). Durante tutte queste attività, l’equipaggio del catamarano TARAS ti farà anche degustare specialità locali.

fields.name: The Arc of Ohio Day at Cedar Point 2015
fields.description:
All Friends of The Arc of Ohio are Welcome!  
The Arc of Ohio invites members, friends, family member and staff to The Arc of Ohio Day at Cedar Point on Wednesday, May 20, 2015. 
  
Ticket Information 
  
Cedar Point has once again donated a limited number of free admission tickets, free picnic lunches and a generous discount on any additional tickets and lunches. 
Each free admission ticket includes a free picnic lunch which typically includes a hot dog, macaroni salad, chips, a dessert and pop. 
Complete the registration and let us know the total number of people you plan to bring to the event, including friends, family and staff. This number does not obligate you to purchase additional tickets, but it gives us an idea of how many people to plan for. We usually receive over 10,000 requests for a limited number of free admission tickets. No one will receive all the free tickets they request, but we make a sincere attempt to distribute the free tickets based on the number of requests. 
Requests for free tickets must be in by midnight on April 27, 2015. We will notify you by email on April 30, 2015 how many free admission tickets and lunches we can offer you; and, also provide you with information on how you may purchase additional lunch tickets. 
Additional lunches must be ordered and paid for before the event. The notice on April 30th will provide a deadline and instructions on how to order additional lunch tickets.  
The allocation of free tickets will be up to each group, but all people entering the park must have a ticket, whether it is one of our free tickets or a ticket purchased at our reduced rate. 
Additional reduced rate tickets will be available from The Arc of Ohio booth on May 20th  until Noon at $32.00 each. Tickets purchased from a Cedar Point ticket booth are $55.00 so this is a significant savings.  
Vehicles 
A standard parking fee will be charged. If your driver wishes to enjoy Cedar Point, he or she must have a ticket. 
  
Rides

fields.name: Maker Faire Bay Area 2015
fields.description:
Come celebrate Maker Media's 19th Maker Faire and 10th anniversary in the Bay Area, showcasing creative and resourceful people in the areas of science and technology, engineering, food, and arts and crafts. 
  
 FRIDAY@MakerFaire - SPECIAL PROGRAM 
  
Click here for ticket info on FRIDAY@MakerFaire - INDUSTRY DAY 
May 15th, 2015 from 1pm - 7pm 
and  
Click here for ticket info on FRIDAY@MakerFaire - SCHOOL 
May 15th, 2015 from 1pm - 5pm 
  
Maker Faire Bay Area - Saturday and Sunday Hours: 
Saturday - May 16th, 2015 from 10am - 8pm 
Sunday - May 17th, 2015 from 10am - 6pm  
   
FAQ’S: 
What day(s) and hour(s) will Maker Faire be open to the public?  
Saturday, May 16th – 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.  
Sunday, May 17th – 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. 
  
I am buying a Single Day Ticket, can I use my ticket for either day?
Yes, you can use your Single Day Ticket for Saturday OR Sunday.
 
Can the Weekend Pass be shared between attendees.
No, the Weekend Pass cannot be shared.
 
The Family Pass says 10am - 1pm for entry on Sunday. Will we be able to stay all day?
Yes, please arrive together as a group, at the same entrance to Maker Faire, between 10am - 1pm in order to use this pass. Family Pass attendees can stay until the Faire closes at 6pm on Sunday. This pass is not available on Saturday. The Family Pass must be bought before you arrive onsite and cannot be purchased/combined with any other offers.
 
Can I leave Maker Faire and come back in during show hours?
Yes, attendees can come in and out of the Faire. You will need to get a stamp at the exit gate before leaving in order to come back in the same day.
 
The tickets have my name but I want to give them as a gift, donate, etc., can they be used by someone else?
Yes, the tickets are transferrable. The name on the ticket DOES NOT need to match the ticket holder at the gate. If you would like to have the name on the ticket changed or removed, please contact tickets@makerfaire.com, we can update the tickets on your behalf. 
 
How do I get my tickets once I have purchased them online?
Tickets purchased on-line, will receive an email confirmation with a link to print your eTickets from your computer. You may bring the print out of your tickets OR you may also add them to your mobile device via the Eventbrite App, PassBook or any PDF Reader.
 
I did not receive an email confirmation when I ordered my tickets, what should I do? Check your spam or gray mail folder, in case it was misdirected. If you are unable to find it, email tickets@makerfaire.com to have it resent. Please include the name and email address used to order the tickets. 
I am not able to print my tickets, what should I do? Adobe has a site which reviews the common issues with printing .pdf files 
http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/873/cpsid_87346.html  
In the article you will see the quickest resolution is to print as an image - Step 1 
If this article doesn't help to resolve the issue, please let us know. We can send you the .pdf as an email attachment rather than having you access the ticket from the link in the email. And of course, if that doesn't work, we can print the tickets and get them to you by another means. Please feel free to reach us at tickets@makerfaire.com. 
  
Where can I park my RV? We suggest you contact the San Mateo Event Center directly to get specific answers to your RV parking questions. Expo Center phone number is (650) 574-3247, their RV parking form is here:  http://www.sanmateoexpo.org/rv-parking/rv-parking-information 
Will you have bike parking? Yes, secure free Valet Bicycle Parking is provided by the Silicon Valley Bicycle Coalition. 

  
PLANNING 
ATMs are available on-site 
Will there be food onsite? Yes. You will find a wide variety of food options at Maker Faire. Outside food or beverages are not permitted through the gates unless you have special medical, dietary or religious requirements. 
Activity Wristbands are required for ALL activities and are available on-site.  
Lockpicking (taking place outside the MakerShed) runs throughout the day - schedule will be posted onsite — and is a first come, first serve activity.
Pets are not allowed, for their safety. Service animals are welcome. 
Strollers, backpacks and a bottle of water are allowed. 
Wheelchairs (push wheelchairs) will be available at the event site for a nominal fee. They will be at the gates on a first come, first serve basis. 
ADA Compliance, accessbile water fountains, eating areas and restrooms are available. 
Will Maker Faire have recycling again this year? Yes. Recycling is priority to our entire community. We will have recycling bins for paper, plastic, glass and composting. 
Rain or Shine. No Refunds/Exchanges. Tickets cannot be replaced. 
  

How much are the tickets? Retail tickets range in price from $15-$45 for a full day pass. Purchase in advance and save up to $25 for a weekend adult pass and even more for groups over 15. Special Early Bird discounted prices for online ticket sales are valid through Feb 28, 2015. Advance ticket prices available online between March 1, 2015 and May 15, 2015. Ticket prices will increase at the gate. Buy early online for the best pricing and to avoid lines at the gates. 
Will Maker Faire tickets be avaible at any retail locations?  Whole Foods Market will NOT be selling Maker Faire tickets this year.   
Who do I contact if I still have questions about tickets, prices, discounts or Maker Faire?       Please email tickets@makerfaire.com.  




  Day Tickets 


Early Bird Purchase Until Feb 28th

Discounts 
Maker Faire offers a variety of discounts off the full retail price.  
Group Discount  15% Discount for group of 15 or more -  must be purchased by May 15th 
Maker Faire was created for people with people!   Come with your friends, family, clubs, company, posse, band, organization, etc. Just follow the directions below and have a blast!  To take advantage of our group discount, tickets MUST be purchased at the same time by one person in your group (minimum of 15).  Please click this link and fill out a bit of information for discount availablity for groups of 15 or more. Group discounts cannot be combined with any other offer. Discount tickets must be purchased by May 15th, 2015 (Midnight PST).  
Military Discount $10 OFF 
Military Discount is good for all U.S. Active Duty (including all National Guard & Reservists) and retired military service members.  Military Discount is $10 off all ticket types for Early Bird, Advance or Onsite ticket sales.  Military ID will be required at the gate. Limit 4 tickets per transaction. This Military Discount cannot be combined with any other offer. To apply your military discount, please click HERE.  
Sunday Family Pass $125.00 ONLINE purchase only  
Valid for entry on Sunday only from 10am-1pm (and you can stay all day on Sunday). Entry for up to 5 attendees and they do not have to be related/family (any age). Please note, this offer is NOT AVAILABLE for purchase onsite. This special offer cannot be combined with other discounts, e.g., Group, Education and/or Military. Sunday Family Pass is $125.00 and must be purchased by May 15th  (Midnight PST). 
  
Maker Faire - Booster Pass Special Offering!  
Become a Maker Faire Booster and help support the efforts of the Makers and the Maker Movement!
 
You and your guest will get to experience Maker Faire from behind the scenes and get the unique opportunity to meet MAKE Editors, Makers, and a host of creative and fun people involved in the making of Maker Faire. 
 
Becoming a Maker Faire Booster entitles you and your guest (two attendees) to: 
 -ACCESS on Friday, May 15th, 2015 for FRIDAY@MakerFaire (from 1pm - 7pm)
 -participate in pre-event activities  
 - get a sneak peak of Makers and their projects during setup on Thursday 
 - enjoy the opening Maker Dinner and Entertainment on Friday evening  
 - access priority parking and gate entrance 
 - gain entry to the Booster Area onsite  
 - receive special "Maker Faire", Maker Shed and MAKE items 
 
Maker Faire Booster passes will be limited.  
Cost: $1,250 (access for two) or $ 750 (access for one)
No discounted tickets apply for this level of sponsorship.
 
 
How can I learn about the Maker Movement and help out during Maker Faire?  
Maker Corps at Maker Faire has a new name:   Maker Faire Traveler Program… it’s a new program designed to support the Maker Movement. Click here to learn more and become part of this great movement.  
  
What if it rains?  The show will go on! Bring rain gear to keep you dry when walking outdoors. Fortunately, we will have many indoor exhibits to keep the family dry. 
  
What can I expect? To have the time of your life! You'll be surprised and intrigued with every corner that you turn.

("MM") and its affiliates.  You acknowledge that Maker Faire exhibits and activities are inherently hazardous, and that risks to you as a Maker Faire attendee include physical injury and property damage. By purchasing this ticket and/or participating in Maker Faire exhibits and/or activities, you assume all risks to you and/or your children of such, including damage, loss, harm, injury and death to your person(s) and all risks resulting from negligent instruction or supervision, and you release MM from all corresponding liability to you and your successors. Your rights are waived to any images and/or recordings you may appear in while at Maker Faire and any/all related promotional or documentary materials.  
http://makermedia.com/privacy

fields.name: Needham Talks: 2014-2015 Needham Elementary School Parent Lecture Series
fields.description:
Needham Talks: 2014-2015 Needham Elementary School Parent Lecture Series 
Fostering Children's Resilience and Social-Emotional Wellness 
Please join us for an exciting free series of talks focused on children's resilience and social-emotional wellness.  Nationally acclaimed speakers will be visiting our community to share their knowledge of social and brain behavior, the emotional lives of girls and boys, how to nurture children's confidence and resilience, and the hidden consequences of the internet.  Reserve your seats today for one, two, or all five lectures!  Space is limited.  Speaker books will be available for purchase at each event. 
Special thank you to Needham Education Foundation (NEF) for funding this lecture series.   Questions: please contact Angeline Maughan at enrichment@newmanptc.org. 
Speakers & Dates: 
October 9, 2014:  Joseph Shrand, M.D. - Theory of Mind and Interpersonal Relationships for Children. 
December 4, 2014:  Rachel Simmons, M.A. - Odd Girl Out: Coping with Best Friends, Worst Enemies and Everything in Between 
March 4, 2015:  Michael Thompson, Ph.D. - Raising Cain: Protecting the Emotional Lives of Boys 
April 9, 2015:  Robert Brooks, Ph.D. - Strategies for Nurturing Confidence and Resilience in Our Children

fields.name: Royal Park Lantern Tour 2015
fields.description:
The infamous RMH historical lantern tours have returned for their fifth season and will run from May until October 2015 at the Royal Park Campus. 
Join RMH history buff and story-teller-extraordinaire Jeff Whittington (pictured) from 7—9pm for a stroll through history.  
Jeff will don his frock coat, vest, top hat, and fob chain, taking people on a tour of the grounds and heritage listed buildings and sharing fascinating stories from the past. 
Tours feature ghosts, graves and many good stories. 
Alice from 1878 will narrate what it was like to be a child in the girls division of the Industrial School, at Royal Park.  Matron from 1869 will also appear, out of the dark, in her full uniform illuminated only by her handheld candle. 
If you are looking for a night of excitement, these lantern tours are a must. 
Tour cost is a paper note donation per head with all proceeds applied towards the campus.    
Some of the tour will be outside, you may need a coat.  Tours are never cancelled because of rain, just bring an umbrella. 
Children must be accompanied by an adult who shall be solely responsible for their care and conduct whilst on Site  
Alcohol is not permitted on any tours. Visitors who are under the influence of alcohol will be asked to leave the Site 
We would also like to remind visitors, staff and patients that The Royal Melbourne Hospital is a smoke free zone.  No smoking is allowed on hospital grounds. 
Here's a sample of comments from Jeff's 2014 tours: 

"Just like to say how much I enjoyed the tour tonight.  It was so much more than I’d expected.  Your Historical Lantern Tour volunteers really brought early Melbourne to life for me and had me thinking about the challenges faced by many of my ancestors who came out to Australia in the 1840’s and 1850’s.  Thanks again for an informative and fun night out." 
"Simply brilliant!  Fact, fiction and comedy combined with finesse.  Thanks to all involved." 
"Thank you for a fantastic tour and history lesson." 

Meeting point is The Royal Melbourne Hospital - Royal Park Campus - 34-54 Poplar Road PARKVILLE 3052. Enter via gate 1 then proceed to, main reception of the Robert Campbell Wing – Building 17 (opposite the main car park). 
See this Google Map for the meeting point. 
Tour leaves at 7pm sharp, and concludes around 9pm. 
Note: Unfortunately we will not wait for anyone who is running late, the tour will commence at 7pm sharp. 
Alcohol is not permitted on any tours. Visitors who are under the influence of alcohol will be asked to leave the Site.  Children must be accompanied by an adult who shall be solely responsible for their care and conduct whilst on Site 
  
We would like to remind visitors, staff and patients that The Royal Melbourne Hospital is a smoke free zone. No smoking is allowed on hospital grounds.

fields.name: Yacht Party Chicago's Saturday Night Booze Cruise on May 2nd!
fields.description:
Come out on our 400 person YACHT for the Saturday Night Booze Cruise on Lake Michigan! Tickets include a Live DJ, Dancing, and a Drink At The After-Party! Catch breathtaking views of the skyline while aboard our Saturday Night Booze Cruise! 
Tickets also include a FREE ride (up to $30) from Uber with the promo code "CTS30" and $20 in FREE dry cleaning and laundry with the promo code "CHITWENTY" from Washio!  Offers valid for first time users only. Click HERE For More Info.  
 
Want to celebrate your birthday on the boat?  If you have 10 or more people in your party, your ticket is on us, and all your friends get a discount!   Email Info@YachtPartyChicago.com for more info! 
  
Group Rates Available for groups of 10+ - Email Info@YachtPartyChicago.com for more info!  
  
 Boarding will begin promptly at 7:30 p.m. Please be on time, as the boat will leave without you!! 
  
The party will go on rain or shine! 
  
 In the event of dangerous conditions the boat may not cruise, but the party will still go on at the dock! In the event of rain, 2 of the 3 floors are enclosed. 
  
 There is NO Dress code! 
  
 There will be full cash bars on all three floors!  
You must be 21+ with valid ID to board.* 
  
Ticketing Technical Issues: Any ticketing / technical issues will be handled by Eventbrite.com. Call Eventbrite customer support at1-888-810-2063 or email Eventbrite support at help@EventBrite.com. 
  
Sorry – No refunds or Price Adjustments  
*Unfortunately the Eventbrite system does not allow us to restrict people who are underage from buying tickets.  If you are not 21 and purchase a ticket, you will not be allowed on board.* 
 
  
Directions:  Getting Dropped off If getting dropped off by taxi, you would take lower Randolph St. east until it ends at the lakefront which is DuSable Harbor. There is a turnaround at the foot of Randolph where it meets the lake. If dropped off at the turnaround you will walk down to the path along the lake and continue north towards the River and end at the yachts. Taxis can also go inside to the end of the DuSable Harbor Parking lot and drop off. If they are there for less than 15 minutes, there is no charge.  Walking From the Loop If walking from the loop you will take any stairway down to the river walk on the south side of the Chicago River walk. It is a 10 minutes walk from the Michigan Ave. bridge to our docking location. The south side river walk ends directly at our yachts. 
  
From the Navy Pier Walk west on Illinois to North Streeter/Lower Lake Shore Drive, the first street on your left. Cross North Streeter/Lower Lake Shore Drive to the west side of the street and turn left. Once you cross over the Chicago River, immediately look for staircase to walk down to river walk. Turn left on river walk and once you exit tunnel, you will continue straight ahead where both yachts are docked in front of you on the Chicago River. 
  
 From Millennium Park Head east towards Columbus Dr. Turn left onto Monroe. Once you cross Lake Shore Drive turn left or walk north on lakefront path. Once you pass Columbia Yacht Club, continue walking north for 4-5 minutes. The path will end at the Chicago River and at our yachts. 
  
Driving From the West Take 90/94 (Kennedy) to the Ohio St. Exit. Take Ohio St. East to Columbus Dr. Take a right onto Columbus Dr then a left onto lower Randolph St. Take Randolph St. east until it ends at the lakefront which is DuSable Harbor. fields.name: 2015 Color of Wealth Summit
fields.description:
#racialwealthgap 
The Center for Global Policy Solutions and the 
Insight Center for Community Economic Development 
invite you to 
 
 The United States of Opportunity: Advancing  a New Social Contract for a Fair and Inclusive Economy 
April 30, 2015; 8:30 a.m.-4:30 p.m. 
SUMMIT AGENDA 
For every dollar in wealth held by the typical white family in 2011, the typical Latino and African-American families only own seven and six cents respectively. Lost in the conversation about inequality in America has been the fact that racial and ethnic wealth inequality is more stark, has a devastating impact on households of color, and, if left unchecked, will have profound implications for the U.S. economy as the nation's demographics shift over the next few decades. 
The summit seeks to engage Members of Congress, Congressional staff, the media, and the public in a dialogue about the racial wealth gap, its effect on marginalized households, its impact on the U.S. economy, and solutions for closing the gap.   

Asset Builder Champion Awards Reception April 29, 2015; 6:30-8:30 p.m. 
 
The reception will highlight and acknowledge the efforts of champions in the asset-building field. These include researchers, business leaders, and practitioners who have contributed greatly to national progress in addressing racial wealth disparities.  
This event is sold out but you can add your name on the waiting list.  We will let you know if a seat becomes available.   
Sponsored by 
 
 

Summit National Partners: Campaign for America's Future, Center for Responsible Lending, CFED (Corporation for Enterprise Development), Haas Institute for a Fair and Inclusive Society, Institute on Assets and Social Policy, Institute for Women's Policy Research, National CAPACD, National Community Reinvestment Coalition, National Congress of American Indians, National Council of La Raza, National Urban League, New America Foundation Asset Building Program. 

The Center for Global Policy Solutions manages the Closing the Racial Wealth Gap Initiative in collaboration with the Insight Center for Community Economic Development and with generous support from the Ford Foundation.

fields.name: Cartagena Data Festival
fields.description:
Registration to attend in person is now closed. 
The world may be awash with more data than ever, but this is not yet always well used to solve global problems like tackling poverty or building more sustainable futures.  There’s a growing divide between those who have information and those who don’t, and between those who are counted and those who are not.  We cannot hope to eliminate poverty and bring about lasting improvements in peoples’ lives without more data on people’s lives, without investing in data access and literacy, and without ensuring that the data that we have is used more directly in policy-making processes. 
What we need is a ‘data revolution’ – a fundamental change in the depth and use of knowledge about the most marginalised people in the world, and in their ability to use this knowledge to affect transformative change. The Cartagena Data Festival will bring together the people and organisations best equipped to make this happen. 
What additional data is needed? How can this be collected? How are data used to make policy? How can people use data to hold governments to account? How can more and better data help to produce long-term, sustainable progress? 
This three-day event, funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation alongside other partners, will gather together policy makers, civil society organisations, technical innovators, academics and data activists to discuss and debate these questions. The festival takes place in the year before new global sustainable development goals take effect. There is no better time to start shaping innovations and building the relationships to implement and monitor these new goals – with better data at the heart. 
Event details 
The festival is hosted by ODI in conjunction with UNDP, CEPEI, PARIS21 and Data-Pop Alliance with the aim of providing an interactive information exchange for those who produce, analyse and use data. Up to 300 participants from across the globe will meet in Cartagena, Colombia, to come up with concrete solutions and practical tools.   The event will engage a variety of audiences, and different tracks focused on: accountability and citizen engagement, big data and new technologies, communicating and visualising data, emerging areas of measurement, official and national statistics and a technical data dive. These will run in parallel during the festival, with specialised partner organisations invited to develop the programmes for each track. View the agenda to see more and for information about how to get involved. 
Register your interest today

fields.name: 82nd Historic Garden Week
fields.description:
Each spring visitors are welcomed to more than 250 of Virginia's most beautiful gardens, homes and historic landmarks during "America's Largest Open House." This 8-day statewide event provides visitors a unique opportunity to see unforgettable gardens at the peak of Virginia's springtime color, as well as beautiful houses sparkling with over 2,000 fabulous flower arrangements created by Garden Club of Virginia members. 
Tour proceeds fund the restoration and preservation of Virginia's historic gardens. To view the almost fifty properties that have benefitted from Historic Garden Week tour proceeds click here. 
**Ticket(s) will be emailed to you as a PDF attachment from Eventbrite.com. Print ticket or show ticket on your smartphone to ticket checker on tour.** 
No pets. No smoking. Tours occur rain or shine. No Refunds.  
*The fee is a convenience fee charged to cover credit card processing costs and Eventbrite's services which allow us to offer online ticket sales. This insures that 100% of proceeds benefit the restoration and preservation of Virginia's historic gardens.  
  
FAQs 
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
Each tour has different transportation and parking options. Visit vagardenweek.org, click on Tour Schedule and click on the tour you are attending for a description of the tour and other information. Or pick a copy of the guidebook (offered for free around the state at local businesses, visitor centers, and AAA's), read the guidebook online here for detailed information about each tour, order a guidebook above at the top of the ticket options, or send a $10 check (shipping and handling) for your own copy to:  
The Garden Club of Virginia 
c/o Historic Garden Week 
12 East Franklin Street 
Richmond, VA 23219 
  
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
vagardenweek@gmail.com  
(804) 644-7776 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
You can print off your ticket that is e-mailed to the e-mail you provided OR you can present your ticket on your smartphone. 
  
What is the refund policy? 
No refunds.  
  
The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay? 
Yes, that is okay. As long as there is a ticket for each attendee.

fields.description:
