Among these include independent video game developer spaces, the Madman National Cosplay Competition, along with guests, panels and workshops on these and related areas of interest to our attendees. 
Ticketing Terms and Conditions 

Children under 10 can enter AVCon 2014 at no charge if accompanied by a ticket holder. A children’s pass can be obtained at-the-door.
Concession pricing is available for at-the-door sales for Government concession card holders; such as Seniors Cards, disability cards or Centrelink Health Care Cards.
Holders of Government Carer Cards or Companion Cards will receive a free ticket at-the-door when accompanying their ward.
No refund or exchange on any ticket except as required by law.
AVCon tickets guarantee entrance into the AVCon festival, but do not guarantee advertised guests, artists or programs. AVCon reserves the right to add, withdraw, reschedule or substitute guests or artists and / or vary advertised programs at any point. Any addition, withdrawal, reschedule or substitution of guests or artists and / or any variation to advertised programs will not entitle a ticket purchaser to a refund.
Entry may be refused if tickets are damaged or defaced in any way or are not purchased from AVCon or other authorised points of sale.
AVCon tickets may not be resold, except with the written consent of AVCon. If a ticket is sold in breach of this condition, the ticket may be cancelled without a refund and the bearer of the ticket may be refused admission.
All prices quoted include the Goods and Services Tax (GST).
Lost Tickets. If your tickets are lost or stolen, you must produce proof of original purchase and ticket number before a ticket will be reissued.
If payment for a ticket is reversed by chargeback or other mechanism, the tickets purchased may be invalidated and the ticket purchaser and associated ticket holders may be barred from future events.
AVCon’s Code of Conduct can be found here at avcon.org.au. By entering AVCon, you agree to the AVCon Code of Conduct.
Inquiries or complaints: if you have an enquiry or complaint, please contact us at ticketing@avcon.org.au.

fields.description:
The 38th Britsh Beekeepers Association Spring Convention is the annual gathering of members of the BBKA, other beekeeping associations and members of the public with an interest in bees and beekeeping.  
The largest and longest running event of its type, based at Harper Adams University, it offers a series of lectures, workshops and courses over three days (17,18 & 19 April 2015). The programme  can be viewed and down-loaded from the BBKA web-site  www.bbka.org.uk  The large Trade Exhibition will be open on the afternoon of Friday 17 and all day Saturday 5 April, where beekeeping's leading traders are represented and beekeeping aids and equipment are on sale at competitive prices with many special show offers. 
Entry tickets (wrist-bands) are available on-line through the BBKA website at www.bbka.org.uk These must be worn at all times to gain admission to events.  Friday 17 April is  Members Day and  Sunday 19 April, our Education Day.  The public and non-members are welcomed  on Saturday 18 April our Public Day. A special day ticket giving admission to the Trade Exhibition only is available for the first time for 2015 
Remember to wear your wrist-band at all times for entry to all events. 
Lectures are open to all ticket holders except those holding Trade Exhibition day tickets. Workshops and Courses may be booked on-line via the web-site as detailed in the ticketing section of this web-site. A course fee is payable for many of the courses and places on others can be pre-booked either by paying a booking fee of £2 to reserve a place.the sum 
Don't forget to bring your paper tickets to all booked events  
Accommodation is available on-site and many delegates stay for the whole weekend on site.  All rooms are single, with en-suite facilities and are bookable by the night through the web-site. Rates are £47 per person per night on a B&B basis. Couples may purchase two adjacent singlerooms at the special rate of £78. 
Catering is excellent at Harper Adams with outlets open throughout the event. There are some optional pre-bookable meals over the weekend; the Welcome Dinner on Thursday evening 16 April at £18; the Conference Dinner on Friday evening 17 April at £25 and the Dinner and Quiz on Saturday evening 18 April at £22. Places are limited. Please book tickets for these meals on this site. More details on catering are available in the programme.  
Please ensure that you bring your paper tickets to all booked events and wear your wrist-band at all times for entry to all events.   
Refunds Full refunds are available up to 30 days before the event and then a 70% refund up to 10 days before the event, thereafter no refund is available. 
If you have specific queries or needs please contact the following: 
Ticket (Wrist-band) Sales: Sarah Snelson - sarah.snelson@britishbeekeepers.com 
Courses & Workshops: Avis Marshall - avismarshall@virginmedia.com 
Accommodation: Nicky Morris - nicky.morris@britishbeekeepers.com   
Pre-booked Dinners: June Hughes - june.hughesbees@btinternet.com

fields.name: 2015 Sony World Photography Awards Exhibition
fields.description:
2015 Sony World Photography Awards Exhibition, London, 24th April – 10th May 
  
Be inspired by the best photography in the world – visit the 2015 Sony World Photography Awards Exhibition at Somerset House, London. 
  
The Sony World Photography Awards is the world’s largest photography competition, attracting the very best contemporary photographers who each offer a unique visual insight into the last year. 
  
Join us at Somerset House, from 24 April – 10 May.  A perfect London day out for families and lovers of art. 
  
The extraordinary images in the Sony World Photography Awards exhibition, taken from the competition’s record-breaking 173,444 entries from 171 countries, have something to appeal to all tastes.  From fine art landscape photography, to hard-hitting photojournalism, glossy commercial campaigns to simply stunning shots of everyday life, the images draw their inspiration from around the world and are taken by both professional photographers and enthusiasts. 
  
The exhibition includes the winners and shortlisted photographers of the 


13 Professional categories  


10 Open categories  


3 Youth categories  


Mobile Phone competition 


Student Focus programme 


  
Categories include: travel; nature & wildlife; current affairs; contemporary issues; landscape; still life; portraits; people; environment; sport; conceptual; campaign; arts & culture; split second; smile, panoramic; enhanced; low light and architecture. 
  
It will also include an intimate display of the still images, books and films of the legendary Magnum photographer, Elliott Erwitt. 
  
Elliott, the recipient of the Outstanding Contribution to Photography award this year, is one of the world’s greatest commercial and documentary photographers.  Known globally for his often ironic black and white images of everyday life, Elliott is equally a master of capturing poetic and subtle beauty in both ordinary scenes and celebrity subjects. 
  
Erwitt will be in London to collect his award and will take part in a rare public talk to coincide with the exhibition.  For more details see below. 
  
In addition, your exhibition ticket offers free entry to: 


#FutureofCities, presented by Sony's Global Imaging Ambassadors and in collaboration with Panos Pictures – a special guest exhibition examining the mass urban shift of the global population in our major cities by photographers from world renowned photo agency, Panos Pictures 


  
If you are looking for a day out in London full of culture and colour, the 2015 Sony World Photography Awards exhibition at Somerset House is where you will find it. 
  
Tickets: 
Anytime Entry: £8.50 
Weekday Entry (10am-4pm): £6.50 
Concessions (weekdays only): £5 
Two tickets (valid anytime): £16 
Four tickets (valid anytime): £30 
  
Concessions tickets can only be used from Monday to Friday. Only Senior Citizens and Students can purchase Concession tickets. Please note: You will need to provide a valid student card on arrival at the exhibition. 
  
Exhibition Hours: 
Mondays 10am to 6pm 
Tuesdays 10 am to 9pm 
Wednesdays 10am to 9pm 
Thursdays 10 am to 9pm 
Fridays 10am to 9pm 
Saturdays 10am - 6pm 
Sundays 10am to 6pm

fields.name: NATIONAL YOUTH EMPOWERMENT SUMMIT 2015
fields.description:
THE CONCERNED YOUTH EMPOWERMENT ASSOCIATION OF NIGERIA  
PRESENTS:  
NATIONAL YOUTH EMPOWERMENT SUMMIT 2015  
THEME: LEADING THE UNEMPLOYED YOUTH FOR GAINFUL EMPLOYMENT, A FORMIDABLE FORCE FOR SUSTAINABLE ECONOMY AND CRIME REDUCTION 
 Focus: Nigerian youths have great aspirations and expectations. They also have great frustration with the slow and ineffective manner with which the successive governments they look up to with anticipation have mishandled the actualization of their aspirations.  
Statistical report from the National Bureau of Statistics shows that over 70% of our youth are currently unemployed. It is our belief that the more the youths are empowered, the less the crime rate in the society.  
Nigerian youths have great aspirations and expectations. They also have great frustration with the slow and ineffective manner with which the successive governments they look up to with anticipation have mishandled the actualization of their aspirations.  
By this National Youth Empowerment Summit, we are forming a formidable force to lead the unemployed for gainful employment, and to cut short the misconstruing of laudable government empowerment initiatives, placing the government in a better position to understand the needs of her people and address it fairly and adequately, without the constraints suffered from the hands of middle men who hijacks the fruits of youth empowerment for their selfish interest.  
This National Youth Empowerment Summit will give true meaning to youth’s creative talents and labour power.  
Our hope lies in creativity, empowerment, skill acquisition and development. Acquiring the needed skills will make our people (youth especially) more creative, resourceful and less destructive. The transformation of Nigeria cannot be achieved without empowerment of the youth.  
Our Skill development and Vocational programs aims to achieve this, by increasing the ability of youth and the society at large to contribute their quota to the society while generating income and creating jobs.  
The Concerned Youth Empowerment Association of Nigeria was founded in 2011. As a patriotic Youth organization, membership is drawn from the six geo – political zones of the federation.  
We work to ensure that Nigerian youth are duly contained in congenial democratic atmosphere devoid of violence, by reducing youth’s restiveness and unemployment through our Skill and Agricultural Empowerment development programmes for gainful employment.  
It is our belief that the more the youths are empowered, the less the crime rate in the society.  
We therefore see it appropriate and affording to give hope to the actualization of youth’s aspirations through Job Creation and Skill Acquisition, and to lead them to benefit more from President Goodluck Ebele Jonathan’s Empowerment Initiatives, by sending this Summit to their doorstep for gainful employment. 
The Summit Structure:  
THE AIMS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE SUMMIT  
 -          To develop youth that are creative and contributive to the socio – economic sector of the country  
  
-          To equip people with necessary skills for self – reliance  
  
-          To give meaningful and relevant knowledge in Agribusiness, Entrepreneurship and information Technology  
  
-          The ability to apply business knowledge to everyday life  
  
-          To provide consultancy services and start – up capital for participants  
  
-          To enlist the unemployed youths looking for white collar job for gainful employment.  
  
SPECIAL FOCUS  
  
-          YOUTH  
TARGET AUDIENCE  
  
-          Youth  
  

Participation: The participants are the Nigerian youth on this Summit website, free of any cost. http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/o/the-concerned-youth-empowerment-association-of-nigeria-7841290481 
Arrangement: Training And Empowerment: 

  

The summit will have four days training for youth farmers to be adequately prepared for next farming season and have the full knowledge of agribusiness , and further assist them in securing the Federal Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development’s soft loan (NIRSAL: Nigeria Incentive – Based Risk Sharing System for Agricultural lending) for farmers without request for collateral. 
The Summit will enlist youths to be trained on a free vocational training at Industrial Training Fund , on the following Vocational Trades: Cake Production/ Pastries, Bread Production, Event Management, Solar Panels / Inverter Installation, Maintenance and Repairs, Plumbing and Tilling, Refrigeration and Air conditioning, Domestic & Industrial Wiring, Computer Maintenance and Networking, and further facilitate the securing of loan from the Bank of Industry to provide the needed machines for their establishment. 
Enlistment of Graduates for White Collar Job Employment: Graduates looking for white collar jobs are to submit their details online (the summit website) for gainful employment through: The Presidential Job Creation Board headed by the Vice President of this federation, with the mandate to create at least three million jobs in a year, and for inclusion into the Graduate Internship Scheme. 
The fifth day is set aside to confer on His Excellency President Goodluck Ebele Jonathan with the Leadership Award of the Grand Commander of Youth Empowerment, together with other Nigerian Leaders.
